org.svvrl.goal.core.util
Class Sets

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.core.util.Sets

public class Sets
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides several set operations.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

product

public static java.util.Set<StateSet> product(java.util.Set<StateSet> sets1,
                                              java.util.Set<StateSet> sets2)
Returns the cross product of two sets of state sets. If the two sets are {s11, s12, ..., s1n} and {s21, s22, ..., s2m}, the product is {s11 ∪ s21, s11 ∪ s22, ..., s11 ∪ s2m, ..., s1n ∪ s21, s1n ∪ s22, ..., s1n ∪ s2m}.

Parameters:
sets1 - a set of state sets
sets2 - a set of state sets
Returns:
the product of the two sets

join

public static <T> java.util.Set<java.util.Set<T>> join(java.util.Set<? extends java.util.Set<T>> sets1,
                                                       java.util.Set<? extends java.util.Set<T>> sets2)
Joins two sets of sets. Assume the first set is {s1, s2, ..., sn} and the second set is {t1, t2, ..., tm}. The returned join will be {s1 ∪ t1, s1 ∪ t2, ... s1 ∪ tm, ..., sn ∪ t1, ..., sn ∪ tm}.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of objects in each set
Parameters:
sets1 - a set of objects
sets2 - a set of objects
Returns:
the join of the two sets

combinations

public static <T> java.util.Set<java.util.Set<T>> combinations(java.util.Set<T>... sets)
Returns all combinations of an array of sets [{e11, e12, ..., e1i}, {e21, e22, ..., e2j}, ..., {en1, en2, ..., enk}], which is {e11 ∪ e21 ∪ ... ∪ en1, e11 ∪ e22 ∪ ... ∪ en1, ..., e1i ∪ e2j ∪ ... ∪ enk}.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of elements
Parameters:
sets - sets of sets
Returns:
all combinations of the array of sets

map

public static <I,O> java.util.Set<O> map(Function<I,O> f,
                                         java.util.Collection<I> input,
                                         java.util.Set<O> output)
Returns a set {f(a1), f(a2), …, f(an)} for a function f and a set {a1, a2, …, an}.

Parameters:
f - a unary function
input - a set of elements
output - a set used to store the results
Returns:
a set obtained by applying the function to every element in the input set
